title: ‘We respect the court… but Lakshman Rekha must not be crossed’: Kiren Rijiju after SC’s sedition order - The Indian Express
content:
1. ‘We respect the court… but Lakshman Rekha must not be crossed’: Kiren Rijiju after SC’s sedition order  The Indian Express
  2. Live News | Sedition Law Updates | Supreme Court Puts On Hold | Politicians React | Latest Breaking  TIMES NOW
  3. BREAKING| KEEP THE SEDITION LAW IN ABEYANCE: SUPREME COURT RULES IN A HISTORIC ORDER [Updated With Order]  Live Law - Indian Legal News
  4. India's top court puts colonial-era sedition law on hold for review  Reuters India
  5. U-turn on sedition law: Govt’s decision to dilute its earlier tough stand is a welcome surprise  The Financial Express
  6. View Full coverage on Google News
description: Law Minister Kiren Rijiju said, "We've made our positions very clear and have informed the court about the intention of our Prime Minister."
